us.ihmc.euclid.geometry.interfaces

Interface LineSegment2DBasics

  • All Superinterfaces:
    us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, LineSegment2DReadOnly, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    FixedFrameLineSegment2DBasics, FrameLineSegment2DBasics
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    FrameLineSegment2D, LineSegment2D

    public interface LineSegment2DBasics
extends LineSegment2DReadOnly, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable, us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable
    Write and read interface for a line segment 2D.

    A line segment 2D is a finite-length line defined in the XY-plane by its two 2D endpoints.

    • Method Summary

      Transforms this line segment using the inverse of the given homogeneous transformation matrix.

        containsNaN in interface LineSegment2DReadOnly
        Returns:
        true if getFirstEndpoint() and/or getSecondEndpoint() contains Double.NaN, false otherwise.

      • setToNaN

        default void setToNaN()
        Sets both endpoints of this line segment to Double.NaN. After calling this method, this line segment becomes invalid. A new pair of valid endpoints will have to be set so this line segment is again usable.
        Specified by:
        setToNaN in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Clearable

      • setToZero

        default void setToZero()
        Sets both endpoints of this line segment to zero.

      • translate

        default void translate(double x,
                       double y)
        Translates this line segment by the given (x, y).

        Note that the length and direction of this line segment remains unchanged.

        Parameters:
        x - the distance to translate this line along the x-axis.
        y - the distance to translate this line along the y-axis.

      • translate

        default void translate(us.ihmc.euclid.tuple2D.interfaces.Tuple2DReadOnly translation)
        Translates this line segment by the given (x, y) contained in translation.

        Note that the length and direction of this line segment remains unchanged.

        Parameters:
        translation - the translation to add to each endpoint of this line segment. Not modified.

      • flipDirection

        default void flipDirection()
        Swaps this line segment's endpoints.

      • shift

        default void shift(boolean shiftToLeft,
                   double distanceToShift)
        Translates this line segment perpendicularly to its direction.
        Parameters:
        shiftToLeft - defines to which side this line segment is to be translated.
        distanceToShift - the distance this line segment is to be shifted.

      • shiftToLeft

        default void shiftToLeft(double distanceToShift)
        Translates this line segment by distanceToShift along the vector perpendicular to this line segment's direction and pointing to the left.

        Note that the length and direction of this line segment remains unchanged.

        Parameters:
        distanceToShift - the distance to shift this line segment.

      • shiftToRight

        default void shiftToRight(double distanceToShift)
        Translates this line segment by distanceToShift along the vector perpendicular to this line segment's direction and pointing to the right.

        Note that the length and direction of this line segment remains unchanged.

        Parameters:
        distanceToShift - the distance to shift this line segment.

      • applyTransform

        default void applyTransform(us.ihmc.euclid.transform.interfaces.Transform transform)
        Transforms this line segment using the given homogeneous transformation matrix.
        Specified by:
        applyTransform in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable
        Parameters:
        transform - the transform to apply on the endpoints of this line segment. Not modified.
        Throws:
        us.ihmc.euclid.exceptions.NotAMatrix2DException - if the rotation part of transform is not a transformation in the XY-plane.

      • applyInverseTransform

        default void applyInverseTransform(us.ihmc.euclid.transform.interfaces.Transform transform)
        Transforms this line segment using the inverse of the given homogeneous transformation matrix.
        Specified by:
        applyInverseTransform in interface us.ihmc.euclid.interfaces.Transformable
        Parameters:
        transform - the transform to apply on the endpoints of this line segment. Not modified.
        Throws:
        us.ihmc.euclid.exceptions.NotAMatrix2DException - if the rotation part of transform is not a transformation in the XY-plane.

      • applyTransform

        default void applyTransform(us.ihmc.euclid.transform.interfaces.Transform transform,
                            boolean checkIfTransformInXYPlane)
        Transforms this line segment using the given homogeneous transformation matrix and project the result onto the XY-plane.
        Parameters:
        transform - the transform to apply on this line segment's endpoints. Not modified.
        checkIfTransformInXYPlane - whether this method should assert that the rotation part of the given transform represents a transformation in the XY plane.
        Throws:
        us.ihmc.euclid.exceptions.NotAMatrix2DException - if checkIfTransformInXYPlane == true and the rotation part of transform is not a transformation in the XY plane.

      • applyInverseTransform

        default void applyInverseTransform(us.ihmc.euclid.transform.interfaces.Transform transform,
                                   boolean checkIfTransformInXYPlane)
        Transforms this line segment using the given homogeneous transformation matrix and project the result onto the XY-plane.
        Parameters:
        transform - the transform to apply on this line segment's endpoints. Not modified.
        checkIfTransformInXYPlane - whether this method should assert that the rotation part of the given transform represents a transformation in the XY plane.
        Throws:
        us.ihmc.euclid.exceptions.NotAMatrix2DException - if checkIfTransformInXYPlane == true and the rotation part of transform is not a transformation in the XY plane.
